programme.title: AFL Premiership Season Ep49
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - A mouth-watering Battle of the Bridge at the SCG. The two NSW teams sit 2nd and 3rd on the ladder, both with 6 wins and one loss. The Sydney Swans had a big win over the Hawks while the GWS Giants impressed against the Lions.

programme.title: AFL Premiership Season Ep50
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - In Twilight Saturday Footy for Round 8, St Kilda take on North Melbourne under the roof. It'll be a battle of the veteran coaches Ross Lyon and Alastair Clarkson, with the Saints in 14th with 2 wins and the Kangaroos winless.

programme.title: AFL Premiership Season Ep51
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - 4th host 1st in a potential finals preview as the Melbourne Demons take on the Geelong Cats at the MCG in Saturday Night Footy. The Cats are undefeated this season with 7 wins, while the Demons have 5 wins and 2 losses.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep12
programme.desc: Sr. 35 - Sophie explores a wildlife garden oasis, Jerry visits a charitable urban farm, Tammy saves a discarded succulent, Jane delights in autumn colour, Josh tours a designer garden, plus we meet a garden-inspired woodblock artist.

programme.title: 8 Nights Out West Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Harris Park is known to locals as Little India; the perfect place for Arka and guests Leah Vandenberg and Bina Bhattacharya to unpack the richness of Indian regional cuisine and reflect on the diversity of being south Asian.

programme.title: India Votes 2024 Ep5
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - We delve into how India's religious minorities are voting, we focus on another region of India to see how much it has changed plus how the queer community is now seen as an important new voting bloc. Presented by Hannah Jose.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent Ep8
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - In Japan, the ancient sport of sumo is wrestling with how to accept women competitors on an equal footing, challenging deeply held traditions. We meet the women who are trying to modernise attitudes in a sport they love.

programme.title: Four Corners Ep10
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Australia's addiction to crystal meth or 'ice' is having devastating consequences, but beyond the street dealer, most are unaware of the drug's murky supply chains - and the faceless figures profiting at the top.

programme.title: The World This Week Ep16
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Beverley O'Connor brings you a weekly roundup of international news from an Australian perspective as reported by ABC News correspondents covering the Indo Pacific, Europe, North America, the Middle East, India and Indonesia.

programme.title: Compass Ep3
programme.desc: Sr. 38 - Homegrown Imam is the real-life House of Gods! Sheikh Shadi is changing the face of Islam here. But not everyone agrees with his views, and the biggest test of his leadership comes with the outbreak of the Israel-Gaza war.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch Ep13
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Join Michael Rowland, Lisa Millar, Bridget Brennan and the team for some of the best conversations as we hear from the big names and entertaining guests who have appeared on News Breakfast.

programme.title: Australian Story Ep8
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - How life has changed for inaugural Alone Australia winner Gina Chick. In conversation with Leigh Sales.

programme.title: Planet America: Fireside Chat Ep15
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - The land of the free and home of the brave or is Washington broken and America's democracy a farce? Chas and John look at gridlock in Congress, chaos on the border, plus questions over age, eligibility and legitimacy.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight Ep35
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - The final word on the day's top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australia's most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: National Press Club Address Ep14
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Dr Angela Jackson, Besa Deda and Dr Aruna Sathanapally address the Press Club for the Women in Economics Network Pre-Budget Address.

programme.title: Landline Ep12
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - A tasty sampler of stories from the land - covering food, agriculture, crops, climate, business and innovation - as we meet the fascinating people who make our rural and regional communities unique. Presented by Pip Courtney.

programme.title: Close Of Business Ep14
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Rachel Pupazzoni presents the week in business, finance and economic news including the latest trends on Australian and international markets, analysing what's going on in the local and global economy and how it affects you.

programme.title: ABC News Regional Ep14
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Take a closer look at what's making headlines in regional and rural Australia. ABC News reporters uncover the news and unique stories about what's really going on outside the big cities. Presented by Amy Culpitt.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast Ep18
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Ease into your Sunday with an engaging mix of news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics and weather. Presented by Johanna Nicholson and Fauziah Ibrahim, plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.title: Insiders Ep13
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Start your Sunday morning with the show the politicians rely on to find out what's going on. David Speers presents Australia's must-watch political program, joined by a panel of the best political analysts and commentators.

programme.title: Offsiders Ep13
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Kelli Underwood and the panel discuss a blockbuster round of rivalry matches in the AFL, State of Origin selection on the line in the NRL, the A-League Women's Grand Final and the A-League Men's Finals series begins.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show Ep10
programme.desc: Sr. 4 - Tiana Penitani and Sam Wykes chat with Samoan and NRLW Tigers player Sala Togatuki, catch up with the PNG women's team at the national rugby championship, and take-off with Tongan kite foil racer JJ Rice.

programme.title: ABC News Ep36
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Dan Bourchier presents the latest from ABC News, following today's top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, expert analysis and all the updated news, sport, weather and information you need.

programme.title: The Pacific Ep5
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Hosts Johnson Raela and Alice Lolohea bring you the latest reports on news, politics, sport, culture and entertainment from the Pacific. Each week on The Pacific we cover the issues that matter most across the Pacific region.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon Ep36
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Dan Bourchier presents the latest from ABC News, following today's top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, expert analysis and all the updated news, sport, weather and information you need.

programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - We delve into how India's religious minorities are voting, we focus on another region of India to see how much it has changed plus how the queer community is now seen as an important new voting bloc. Presented by Hannah Jose.

programme.title: AFL Premiership Season Ep52
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - In Sunday Arvo Footy for Round 8, Richmond host Fremantle at the MCG. The Tigers are 16th on the ladder with only 1 win this season while the Dockers impressed beating the Bulldogs for their 4th win to climb into the Top 8.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep12
programme.desc: Sr. 35 - Sophie explores a wildlife garden oasis, Jerry visits a charitable urban farm, Tammy saves a discarded succulent, Jane delights in autumn colour, Josh tours a designer garden, plus we meet a garden-inspired woodblock artist.

programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Hosted by award-winning journalist Pip Courtney, Landline is Australia's only national agricultural television program covering stories from Australia's rural and regional heartland.

programme.title: ABC National News Ep126
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and today's stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: Khanh Ong's Wild Food Ep10
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Chef Khanh Ong sets up camp on the Mornington Peninsula, Victoria to cook a three course meal inspired by his travels. Each meal being a nod to some of the wild and wonderful locations that he has travelled to.

programme.title: Muster Dogs Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - At ten months the dogs have hit puberty and are starting to show some teenage rebelliousness. There are mixed levels of success in the assessment, and one of our pups falls gravely ill.

programme.title: The Family Court Murders Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - The series begins at the NSW Supreme Court where we hear if Leonard Warwick - a man accused of four murders and five bombings that hit at the very heart of Australia's legal system - will walk free, or face justice.

programme.title: Australian Story Ep8
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - How life has changed for inaugural Alone Australia winner Gina Chick. In conversation with Leigh Sales.

programme.title: Anh's Brush With Fame Ep12
programme.desc: Sr. 6 - Gai Waterhouse is the leading lady of Australian horse-racing. She took over the family stable in 1992, became one of the top trainers of all time, and even worked for the Queen. How will Anh capture her verve and charisma?

programme.title: Stuff The British Stole Ep6
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - For well over a century the remains of Yagan, an Indigenous Noongar warrior from WA, were missing in the UK. The search for Yagan and the fight to bring him home is one of history's wildest detective stories. (Final)

programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the day's top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep25
programme.desc: Sr. 32 - Costa Georgiadis explores an extensive Sydney garden, Clarence Slockee looks at new release plants, Tino Carnevale learns how to grow tea, and Sophie Thomson visits a bamboo orchard planted for pandas.

programme.title: Muster Dogs Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 2 - At ten months the dogs have hit puberty and are starting to show some teenage rebelliousness. There are mixed levels of success in the assessment, and one of our pups falls gravely ill.

programme.title: Landline Ep13
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Hosted by award-winning journalist Pip Courtney, Landline is Australia's only national agricultural television program covering stories from Australia's rural and regional heartland.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing Ep71
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Live from Parliament House in Canberra, Greg Jennett brings you everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs today, speaking with the key decision makers and stakeholders on issues in the news.

programme.title: ABC News with Joe O'Brien Ep91
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Joe O'Brien brings you a comprehensive summary of the day's events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on what's going on.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia Ep11
programme.desc: Sr. 10 - Warehouse living in the buzzy inner city was a long held dream for Anita and Kris after years of living in Sydney's suburban south. When the old Newtown Hat Factory comes on the market, they jump in, dazzled by its potential.

programme.title: 8 Nights Out West Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Harris Park is known to locals as Little India; the perfect place for Arka and guests Leah Vandenberg and Bina Bhattacharya to unpack the richness of Indian regional cuisine and reflect on the diversity of being south Asian.

programme.title: ABC National News Ep127
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and the day's stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Joe O'Brien.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep69
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight Ep91
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - More news, more often - the home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the issues that matter. The ABC's network of reporters cover important stories and bring you news and information you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The Business Ep57
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - As the Reserve Bank Board deliberates on Interest Rates, economists and markets wait to see what the RBA Governor's statement on monetary policy will reveal about inflation and the state of the economy.

programme.title: The World Ep73
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - There's never been a more important time to stay in touch with what's happening in our world. Now at the new earlier time of 9pm AEST, Beverley O'Connor presents the latest international news from correspondents and guests.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Indonesia has embarked on a radical plan to relocate its congested and sinking capital Jakarta to the jungles of Borneo. A new $45 billion mega city is currently being built but critics say it's too expensive and too remote.

programme.title: The Pacific Ep5
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Hosts Johnson Raela and Alice Lolohea bring you the latest reports on news, politics, sport, culture and entertainment from the Pacific. Each week on The Pacific we cover the issues that matter most across the Pacific region.

programme.title: Q+A Ep8
programme.desc: Sr. 17 - Patricia Karvelas leads the conversation as citizens put their questions to local and international politicians and thought leaders. Q+A brings together a range of guests to debate the big issues affecting Australians.

programme.title: ABC Late News Ep91
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Follow the story with the latest on today's news, explaining what's happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe covering what you need to know. Presented by Jade Barker in Perth.

programme.title: The Business Ep57
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - As the Reserve Bank Board deliberates on Interest Rates, economists and markets wait to see what the RBA Governor's statement on monetary policy will reveal about inflation and the state of the economy.

programme.title: India Votes 2024 Ep5
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - We delve into how India's religious minorities are voting, we focus on another region of India to see how much it has changed plus how the queer community is now seen as an important new voting bloc. Presented by Hannah Jose.

programme.title: DocFilm
programme.desc: Mediterranean Journey - Sicily - Italy. As she travels the Mediterranean, journalist Sineb El Masrar visits Sicily, Italys largest island. She meets citrus farmers and puppeteers, and journeys from active volcano Mount Etna to the regional capital, Palermo, a hub for marine rescue efforts.

programme.title: Mencari Ramli Musim Ke - 4 Ep5
programme.desc: Program pencarian bakat bola sepak yang hebat diteruskan lagi dengan Musim Ke-4. programme.title: Sensasi Bola Ep4
programme.desc: Sensasi Bola merupakan satu program bual bicara berdurasi setengah jam bersama pemain bola sepak, selebriti, jurulatih dan peminat sebagai tetamu undangan setiap minggu. Antara topik menarik yang akan dikupas adalah isu mengenai bola sepak tempatan dan antarabangsa, temubual ekslusif bersama lagenda bola sepak, tips kesihatan serta isu semasa yang menjadi perbualan masa kini.

programme.title: LIVE: UFC 301: Pantoja vs. Erceg
programme.desc: Prelims - Rapidly turning into a dominant fighter settling in for a long reign at the top, UFC flyweight champion Alexandre Pantoja returns home to Brazil on Saturday, May 4, to defend his crown for the second time against surging Australian contender Steve Erceg in the main event of UFC 301 at Farmasi Arena in Rio de Janeiro. Winner of five in a row, Pantoja has been a man on a mission, and after a 2023 campaign in which he won and defended his title against Brandon Moreno and Brandon Royval, hes back to meet Erceg, who is perfect in three trips to the Octagon. Plus, the King of Rio returns to the Octagon, as UFC Hall of Famer Jose Aldo makes the walk for the first time since 2022 to face Jonathan Martinez
